item.title: Critical Role Campaign 4 Trailer Introduces Us to the Land of Araman
item.content:encoded:
The trailer for Critical Role Campaign 4 has arrived. The newest campaign by the acclaimed actual play series will introduce a new expansive cast of characters, a different face behind the GM screen, and a brand new fantasy setting. All of this and more are teased in this trailer.

The official Critical Role Campaign 4 trailer is light on artwork, but heavy on atmosphere. It is carried with voice-over by GM Brennan Lee Mulligan, dropping events and proper names like the Falconer's Rebellion, the Sundered Houses, and the Revolutionary Council, and stating that the players' grandparents have defied the gods.

This worldbuilding is crucial since the major selling point of Campaign 4 is that it is not set in Matt Mercer's world of Exandria. Instead, it is set in the world of Araman, a world that has recently seen the death of their gods. Because of this, the trailer is helping set the world of Araman apart from the land that hosted the heroics of Vox Machina and the Mighty Nein.

When paired with the video description, the Critical Role Campaign 4 trailer seems to confirm where this story will begin. The party is brought together to uncover the truth of the fate of hero Thjazi Fang, who has been marked for execution. To this end, they will journey across the fractured world and connect in ways never imagined.

This campaign is one packed with firsts for the actual play series. This is the first long-form campaign not GM'd by Matt Mercer; instead, it will be helmed by Dimension20's own Brennan Lee Mulligan. In addition, the campaign will be done West Marches-style, spanning three tables of characters set in different locations across the vast fantasy setting of Araman.

Alongside the Critical Role Campaign 4 trailer, the official Critical Role website posted official art of the characters featured in this new adventure. The cast featured is as follows:

  • Laura Bailey as Thimble
  • Luis Carazo as Azune Nayar
  • Robbie Daymond as Kattigan Vale
  • Aabria Iyengar as Thaisha Lloy
  • Taliesin Jaffe as Bolaire Lathalia
  • Ashley Johnson as Vaelus
  • Matt Mercer as Sir Julien Davinos
  • Whitney Moore as Tyranny
  • Liam O'brien as Halandil Fang
  • Marisha Ray as Murray Mag'Nesson
  • Sam Riegel as Wicander Halovar
  • Alexander Ward as Occtis Tachonis
  • Travis Willingham as Teor Pridesire

Critical Role Campaign 4 will premiere October 2 Youtube, Twitch, and Beacon.

Ever since he was small, Tyler Chancey has had a deep, abiding love for video games and a tendency to think and overanalyze everything he enjoyed. Thisâ€¦ More about Tyler
